item.title: Mairi add a quote by Gregory Maguire
item.description: "She dropped her shyness like a nightgown, and in the liquid glare of sunlight on old boards she held up her hands-as if, in the terror of the upcoming skirmish, she had at last understood that she was beautiful. In her own way." -- Gregory Maguire

item.title: Mairi add a quote by Gregory Maguire
item.description: "That was such a wonderful time, even in its strangeness and sadness-and life isn't the same now. It's wonderful, but it isn't the same." -- Gregory Maguire

item.title: Mairi add a quote by Gregory Maguire
item.description:
"You could say that Elphaba brought us together,' said Boq softly. 'I'm closer to her and so I'm closer to you.'
Galinda seemed to give up. She leaned her head back on the velvet cushions of the swing and said, 'Boq, you know despite myself I think you're a little sweet. You're a little sweet and you're a little charming and you're a little maddening and you're a little habit-forming.'
Boq held his breath.
But you're little!' she concluded. 'You're a Munchkin, for god's sake!'
He kissed her, he kissed her, he kissed her, little by little by little." -- Gregory Maguire

item.title: Mairi add a quote by Gregory Maguire
item.description: "Memory is a part of the present. It builds us up inside; it knits our bones to our muscles and keeps our hearts pumping. It is memory that reminds our bodies to work, and memory that reminds our spirits to work to: it keeps us who we are.~Candle" -- Gregory Maguire

item.title: Mairi add a quote by Gregory Maguire
item.description: "...and Ama Clutch was gone, and the overly subordinate pillowcase took a small spill of human juice from the edge of her slackened mouth." -- Gregory Maguire

item.title: Mairi add a quote by Gregory Maguire
item.description: "Her sister's shoes. They sparkeled even in the darkening afternoon. They sparkeled like yellow diamonds, and embers of blood and thorny stars." -- Gregory Maguire

item.title: Mairi add a quote by Gregory Maguire
item.description: "The moon rose, an opalescent goddess tipping light from her harsh maternal scimitar." -- Gregory Maguire

item.title: Mairi add a quote by Gregory Maguire
item.description: "The body apologizes to the soul for its errors, and the soul asks forgiveness for squatting in the body without invitation." -- Gregory Maguire
